page.title: 01Whelpingtons Northumberland
page.content: Kirkwhelpington is a most atractive village with views to the Wanney Crags nd over the Warsbeck valley. Heavy main road traffic has been diverted from the village. Buildings ar mostly stone and gardens well kept. Hodgson, the historian lived in the Rectory and recorded the area in 1830. Sir Charles Parsons is buried here. There were 2 mills, now disused. Farming is mainly rearing sheep and catle, but some corn is grown. Trees inhabit valleys ad provide shelter belts. Westwards means increasing remoteness and West Whelpington, once with a tower and houses, is now populated only by rabbits and sheep. Quarrying has removed about half the site, but it ws excavated in advance. Some of the quarry buildings are used as a carpentry shop and store, mainly for gun racks used by sportsmen & Army.
